def: An exclamatory word or phrase, equivalent to nonsense![Colloq.]
A follower of John Hutchinson of Yorkshire, England, whobelieved that the Hebrew Scriptures contained a complete system ofnatural science and of theology.
The Parliament of Norway, chosen by indirect election once inthree years, but holding annual sessions.
A name given to several malvaceous trees (species of Hibiscus,Ochroma, etc.), and to their strong fibrous inner bark, which is usedfor strings and cordage.

A swiveling carriage, consisting of a frame with one or morepairs of wheels and the necessary boxes, springs, etc., to carry andguide one end of a locomotive or a car; -- sometimes called bogie inEngland. Trucks usually have four or six wheels.
One skilled in steganography; a cryptographer.
A thin, serous fluid commonly discharged from ulcers or foulwounds.
A pun.Puns, which he calls paragrams. Addison.
Inclined to worry or fret; also, causing worry or annoyance.
That form of church government which invests presbyters withall spiritual power, and admits no prelates over them; also, thefaith and polity of the Presbyterian churches, taken collectively.
